overview:
This course provides registered nurses with the knowledge and skills for a specialist role as an advanced nurse at a graduate diploma level. Students can tailor the diploma to their area of specialty or role. There is a large selection of elective subjects that encompass the areas of clinical, chronic and complex care (ageing and palliation); primary health care; education; management; and research.

This course is designed so that students can tailor their subject choices to meet their individual needs. The knowledge, skills and expertise gained enable students to enhance the quality of care for patients and their families. Students develop skills to actively contribute to the professional development of others and use evidence to make informed decisions about nursing practice. Highly respected by employers and clinicians alike, this course develops a variety of career options.

learning_outcomes.text: Critically evaluate practice, policy and research to enhance evidence-based health care.
Collaborate and lead to advocate for change to enable optimal healthcare delivery and health-promoting environments.
Demonstrate ethical and accountable approaches to professional practice to ensure equity of access to health care.
Communicate effectively in diverse contexts to facilitate healthy behaviours.

Critically appraise knowledge and skills to ensure practice is based on professional standards while promoting the principals of self care that build resilience and foster commitment to lifelong learning.

notes:
This is an exit-only course. There is no direct admission to it. Current UTS students may be able to submit an Internal Course Transfer (Graduating) application to exit with this course. See the Course transfer page for further details.

This course is not offered to international students.
admission_requirements: None; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
career_options: Career options include leadership positions in advanced roles, e.g. clinical, chronic and complex care (ageing and palliation), primary health care, education, management, research, clinical nurse specialist or consultant, nursing management, complex case management, nursing education, and aged care.
course_structure:
Students must complete a total of 48 credit points (eight subjects).
